data.title: Widget::setSwallowTouches will be dropped after disabling/enabling of widget's touch.
data.body: If I'll set swallowing touches to `false` through public interface and than disable and re enable widget's touch - it will swallow touches again. Also I can't change widget's touch swallowing if it's touch is disabled now. It looks slightly confusing.

data.title: Add missing 'override' keywords
data.body:
Hello, when I tried to build with clang 3.6 for Android NDK, I get the following warnings:

```
platform/android/CCFileUtils-android.h:62:10: warning:
      'init' overrides a member function but is not marked 'override'
      [-Winconsistent-missing-override]
    bool init();
         ^

platform/android/CCFileUtils-android.h:80:25: warning:
      'getWritablePath' overrides a member function but is not marked 'override'
      [-Winconsistent-missing-override]
    virtual std::string getWritablePath() const;
                        ^

platform/android/CCFileUtils-android.h:81:18: warning:
      'isAbsolutePath' overrides a member function but is not marked 'override'
      [-Winconsistent-missing-override]
    virtual bool isAbsolutePath(const std::string& strPath) const;
                 ^
```

This pull request adds several missing `override` keywords and fixes them. Thanks.

data.title: Scroll view setInnerContainerSize customization needed.
data.body:
Calling setInnerContainerSize method of scroll view causes "jumping" of scroll to top left position if container size is more than scroll view size. It would be great to have way to customize that behavior. 
Now, if you have scroll view with dynamically changing content, you need to avoid of using setInnerContainerSize, or make position correction after it's call.

data.title: Fixed subtle documentation issues
data.body: Continued fixing spelling, typo, spacing + sentence flow issues.

data.title: Renderer improvments: TriangleCommand and QuadCommand merged
data.body:
- more options for batching (faster)
- less flushing in between commands (faster)
- less renderer code (easier to maintain)
- less VBO/VAO (less memory)
- uses temporary buffer for faster rendering (more memory)
- `QuadCommand` is just a subclass of `TriangleCommand` (simpler)
  - but allocates indices internally (like any `TriangleCommand`) (more memory)
- adds more tests for `SpritePolygon`
- adds test for batching `Tri` + `Quad` command

and fixes some other bugs

Squashed commit of the following:

data.title: Delay in stepSimulate (Buttle Physics)
data.body: There seems to be a delay in stepSimulate(float );

data.title: Cannot edit decimal value in CocosStudio 3.10 on Windows with decimal separator other than dot.
data.body:
If the decimal separator is not the dot (.), like in French where it's the comma (,), edition of decimal values in Cocos Studio (like anchor point, position, size...) is not possible.
The only thing possible is to clear the current value and set an integer value.

The only way to work around it is to go in Windows regional options and change the decimal separator.

In previous versions of Cocos Studio, typing the decimal separator was not possible, but editing values was working.

data.title: Error in UITextField on mobile devices
data.body:
Using Cocos2d-JS v3.10, I had errors on some mobile devices with the UITextField component.

First error:

```
TypeError: Cannot read property 'call' of undefined
at apply(../../frameworks/cocos2d-html5/extensions/ccui/uiwidgets/UITextField.js:489:16)
  at attachWithIME(../../frameworks/cocos2d-html5/cocos2d/text-input/CCTextFieldTTF.js:324:15)
  at attachDelegateWithIME(../../frameworks/cocos2d-html5/cocos2d/text-input/CCIMEDispatcher.js:372:12)
  at _focusDomInput(../../frameworks/cocos2d-html5/cocos2d/text-input/CCIMEDispatcher.js:395:28)
```

this happens with this User-Agent
`Mozilla/5.0 (Linux; Android 4.2.2; GT-S7275R Build/JDQ39) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/48.0.2564.95 Mobile Safari/537.36`

Second error:

```
TypeError: Window.prototype.prompt is undefined
  at func(../../frameworks/cocos2d-html5/extensions/ccui/uiwidgets/UITextField.js:489:16)
  at self(../../frameworks/cocos2d-html5/cocos2d/text-input/CCTextFieldTTF.js:324:15)
  at cc(../../frameworks/cocos2d-html5/cocos2d/text-input/CCIMEDispatcher.js:372:12)
  at _focusDomInput(../../frameworks/cocos2d-html5/cocos2d/text-input/CCIMEDispatcher.js:395:16)
```

this happens with this User-Agent  
`Mozilla/5.0 (Android 4.1.1; Mobile; rv:44.0) Gecko/44.0 Firefox/44.0`

data.title: Avoid creating temporary string objects
Console refactor
data.body:
Refactoring of existing code.
1. Common
   - And the private functions to the methods of Utility class, made available from external code to add the command.
   - The option of command reconstituted in sub-command was set to be held in the nest.
   - From member variables "help" of Command structure, it was to be able to output the help of sub-command.
   - It was to organize the command options handling.
2. command Allocator
   - supported option "-h" and option "help".
3. command Config
   - supported option "-h" and option "help".
4. command DebugMsg
   - supported option "-h" and option "help".
   - Set the help wording options.
5. command Director
   - deleted option "help" code.
   - Set the help wording options.
6. command Exit
   - supported option "-h" and option "help".
7. command FileUtils
   - supported option "-h" and option "help".
   - Quit the error wording output when an invalid option is specified.
   - Set the help wording options.
   - Non-flush option (including the empty) was so as to print when you are specified.
8. command Fps
   - supported option "-h" and option "help".
   - Set the help wording options.
   - Non-on/off option (including the empty) was so as to print when you are specified.
9. command Help
   - supported option "-h" and option "help".
10. command Projection
    - supported option "-h" and option "help".
    - Set the help wording options.
    - Quit the error wording output when an invalid option is specified.
    - Non-2d/3d option (including the empty) was so as to print when you are specified.
11. command Resolution
    - supported option "-h" and option "help".
12. command SceneGraph
    - supported option "-h" and option "help".
13. command Texture
    - supported option "-h" and option "help".
    - Set the help wording options.
    - Quit the error wording output when an invalid option is specified.
    - Non-flush option (including the empty) was so as to print when you are specified.
14. command Touch
    - deleted option "help" code.
    - Set the help wording options.
15. command Upload
    - No change
16. command Version
    - supported option "-h" and option "help".

data.title: bug fix to createAttachSprite3DNode. original code is attach to self …
data.body:
Bug fix to createAttachSprite3DNode.
Original code is attach to self node.
For this reason , it is wrong position of the attached node .
Bug fix code is attach to parent node.

data.body:
MenuItemFont instance run a action, the action is FlipX::create(true), the program crash.  How to solve the problem?  

MenuItemFont has not _textureAtlas member variable, but it use the variable(force MenuItemFont  to convert to Sprite), When flip update it. 

so the  _textureAtlas is wild pointer, isn't it?

data.title: fixed screen flicker when playing video on android
Scale9Sprite a problem
[Cocos2d-x JS] Change texture of specific mesh in Sprite3D
data.body:
Hi cocos2d developer

Recently, I encountered a problem which was about changing texture of a Sprite3D.
`setTexture` method of Sprite3D you have provided, changes texture of every mesh in Sprite3D, and this is not what we expected.

I mean, there should be a way to change the texture of specific mesh. 
While I trace deep into native code, I found out that CCMesh declared `setTexture` method which was using polymorphism, and thus made you skip binding them to the javascript.

I strongly suggest that this requirement should be added officially.
ex :
`mySprite3D.getMeshByName("card").setTextureByFile("res/card.png");`

Thanks in advance

data.title: Label setBlendFunc not working
data.body:
When changing the BlendFunc of a Label, nothing is happening at all. I am working on an iMac and testing on iOS 7.1 and have also tried switching the Label's type, which also doesn't work. To reproduce the issue, just create a new Label and set its BlendFunc (in this case it's one used for masking that can be used perfectly fine with normal sprites):
`auto label = Label::createWithTTF("Text", "fonts/Example.ttf", 14); label->setBlendFunc((BlendFunc){GL_ONE_MINUS_DST_ALPHA, GL_DST_ALPHA}); this->addChild(label);`

data.title: Fixed TargetedAction::isDone always return false!
Refactor HttpRequest and HttpResponse
data.body:
This PR refactors HttpRequest and HttpResponse. It does the following:
- remove unnecessary semicolon
- fix indentation
- replace NULL with nullptr
- mark getter functions as `const`
- remove unnecessary `clear()` calls in constructor
- use `_headers.data()` instead of `_headers.front()`
- use `_requestData.empty()` instead of `_requestData.size()`

Thank you for your time and attention.

data.title: cocos2d-x 3.10 fails linking js-tests when building Release on Visual Studio 2014
data.body:
I'm getting this link error for js-tests when building cocos2d-x 3.10 on Visual Studio 2014, but only for the Release configuration (Debug works fine), and I have no idea how to fix it:

```
Code: LNK2019
Description: unresolved external symbol "__declspec(dllimport) public: class JSObject * __thiscall ScriptingCore::getGlobalObject(void)" (__imp_?getGlobalObject@ScriptingCore@@QAEPAVJSObject@@XZ) referenced in function "struct js_proxy * __cdecl js_get_or_create_proxy<class Effect3DOutline>(struct JSContext *,class Effect3DOutline *)" (??$js_get_or_create_proxy@VEffect3DOutline@@@@YAPAUjs_proxy@@PAUJSContext@@PAVEffect3DOutline@@@Z)
Project: js-tests
File: <path to my cocos2d-x 3.10 local copy>\tests\js-tests\project\proj.win32\js_Effect3D_bindings.obj
Line: 1
```

For now I have removed js-tests from my Release build as I don't need it, but I'm sure this should be fixed!

Thanks,
Julia
